intro: Rhexia ericoides, commonly known as the swamp pink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, showcasing its adaptability to humid environments. The plant features small, clustered pink or white flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a delicate beauty to its habitat. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Rhexia ericoides plays an important role in wetland ecosystems, supporting pollinators and maintaining ecological balance.
